text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies, I got so many requests

from you guys to do something from Mario,
so today we are going to be
making Bob-omb Truffles! Let’s get started!

The things you will need, will be: A box of
brownie mix, 2/3 cup of sugar, 1 cup

of flour, 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract, 2
sticks of butter which equals 1

cup of butter. You’re also gonna need to
decorate some black candy melts,

a bag of Gardettos, we are gonna be using
the small baby pretzels
out of this bag.

Some mini M&M’s, regular M&M’s, a mixer,
I’m gonna use a hand mixer today.

Then some rainbow licorice rope, and some
white frosting.
Now let’s put it all together!

The first thing that we’re gonna do is whisk
together our dry ingredients

in a big mixing bowl. So you’re gonna add
your brownie mix, and your flour,
and sugar, and whisk it up!

Now we’re gonna add our butter, I’ve melted
mine in the microwave,

just make sure it’s totally melted, re-oop!
And, our vanilla extract.

Now we’re gonna mix it together until it’s
well combined and it will be really

thick. Once your fudge mixture is ready, we
are gonna be rolling them into

small little balls. Right here I’ve got
a cookie sheet with a piece of parchment

paper down so they won’t stick to the tray.
And you’re just gonna take a pinch,

it’s a little bit crumbly, so you’re just
gonna pack them together gently,
and then gently roll them.

You can make these any size you'd like, but
truffles tend to be on the
smaller side, and I like them bit size!

And then then you’re gonna do this to the
rest of your truffles.

Once your truffles are rolled, we’re gonna
put these in the fridge for

about 1 hour, to fully chill. And right before
we take them out, you’re gonna
want to heat up your black candy melts.

After your truffles have chilled, we are going
to dip them.

And here I’ve got the black candy melts
all heated up, I’ve got a little fondue

pot that keeps them warm. But you can use
the microwave! You can just heat

them up in the microwave and dip them into
a cup or a bowl, same difference!
This just makes it a little bit easier.

So you’re gonna take a toothpick and just
poke 1 of your little truffles,

then we’re gonna dip the little truffle, go all
the way down, straight down.
Let the excess candy drip off, drip-drip-drip-drip-drip-drip-drip!

And then we’re gonna place it it into our styrofoam
block over here.

Then we’re gonna do that to the rest of
our truffles.
Time for my favorite part! Time to decorate!

Take 1 of our little dipped truffles, and
we are gonna attach 2 yellow M&M’s

on the bottom, ooh, we gotta flip upside down.
For the little Bob-omb feet.

So right here, I’ve separated a bunch of
yellow M&M’s, and I’m gonna take

a toothpick and dip it into our melted candy,
and put a little glob here

at the bottom, so that the feet will stick.
And you’re gonna take 2 yellow
M&M’s, and attach ‘em!

I’m using the curve from the side of the plate to attach
the feet so that they’ll sit at
a really good angle. Aww, just like that!

And then you’ll do that to the rest of your
dipped truffles.

The feet have had plenty of time set, and
now, here’s the Gardetto’s mix,

it’s a snack mix and I’ve separated the
little baby pretzels.

These will be the little cranks on the back
of the Bob-omb.

We’re gonna do the same thing as before,
but attach the crank at the back of

the Bob-omb. Put a little glob at the back,
boop-boop-boop-boop-boop!

Then you’re gonna take a little pretzel,
put it back on the plate,

and use it as an anchor. Then you’re gonna
attach the little pretzels on
the rest of your truffles.

Got all of the little pretzels on our Bob-ombs,
and now we’re gonna make the top

of the Bob-omb, the little fuse. So we’re
gonna take some mini M&M’s,

I’ve separated a bunch of them, here’s
our little blue M&Ms.

And we’ve got our rainbow licorice, and
we’re gonna peel out the white.

And we’re just gonna cut about 1/2 an inch,
and then we’re gonna

use the same technique using the melted candy.
Just dip the toothpick and

a little bit onto the end, just a little bit.
And then we’re gonna stick it

on the top of blue M&M. and we’re gonna
hold it there until it sets,

it sets really quickly, so you don’t have
to hold it for very long.

Dee-dew! There’s our little fuse! And now
we’re gonna make 1 for every truffle.

Now we are gonna attach our little fuses,
so you’re gonna take 1 of your truffles,

and we’re gonna remove the toothpick. And
to do this, it’s really easy,

just pinch on each side of your truffle, and
twist-twist-twist-twist-twist!

And pull! Now we’re gonna take a toothpick
again dip it in the melted candy,

put a little bit at the bottom of the M&M,
and then we’re gonna stick it
right on top, where the hole is.

Our Bob-ombs are totally assembled now, but
we are onto he final decoration

step which is adding their little eyeballs!
Over here, I’ve just got some white

icing, in a plastic baggie with a number 2
tip,

and I’m just gonna be frosting on their
little eyes.
Da-dew! That’s what he looks like!
And now we’re gonna do the rest of our Bob-ombs!

Ta-da! Here are the Bob-omb Truffles that
we made today! I hope you guys

liked them, they were super fun and easy to
make!

I’ll be posting lots of pictures of these little
guys on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, and

Instagram! And if you guys make these, please
take a picture and send me a photo,

I get a big kick out of seeing your baking
creations!

It just kinda makes my day! And, if you guys
have any other ideas for any

other Nerdy Nummies, please let me know, leave
me a comment down below

and I will do my best to make it happen! Alright,
thanks again you guys!
Bye-bye!
I’m a bomb and I’m bout to blow up!
Pfffff!
I love that song!
